content.en: Fracture prediction: Researchers are exploring the use of machine learning algorithms to improve the prediction of hip fractures and other related conditions. These algorithms, such as machine learning principles, classification and regression trees, and supervised machine learning, are being used to analyze various types of data, including MRI scans, administrative claims data, and electronic health records. By harnessing the power of these algorithms, scientists hope to develop more accurate fracture prediction models and improve clinical detection of conditions like osteoporosis and low bone mineral density.
content.da: Frakturforudsigelse: Forskere undersøger brugen af maskinlæringsalgoritmer for at forbedre forudsigelsen af hoftebrud og andre relaterede tilstande. Disse algoritmer, såsom maskinlæringsprincipper, klassifikations- og regressionsstræer og overvåget maskinlæring, bruges til at analysere forskellige typer data, herunder MR-scanninger, administrative kravdata og elektroniske sundhedsoptegnelser. Ved at udnytte kraften i disse algoritmer håber forskerne at udvikle mere nøjagtige frakturforudsigelsesmodeller og forbedre klinisk detektion af tilstande som osteoporose og lav knoglemineraltæthed.
